name: backgroundColor
desc:
Background color of legend, which is transparent by default.

> Color can be represented in RGB, for example `'rgb(128, 128, 128)'`. RGBA can be used when you need alpha channel, for example `'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)'`. You may also use hexadecimal format, for example `'#ccc'`.

name: borderColor
desc: Border color of legend. Support the same color format as backgroundColor.

name: borderWidth
desc: Border width of legend.

name: borderRadius
desc:
The radius of rounded corner. Its unit is px. And it supports use array to respectively specify the 4 corner radiuses.

For example:
```
borderRadius: 5, // consistently set the size of 4 rounded corners
borderRadius: [5, 5, 0, 0] // (clockwise upper left, upper right, bottom right and bottom left)
```

name: shadowBlur
desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```ts
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```


**Attention**: This property works only if `show: true` is configured and `backgroundColor` is defined other than `transparent`.

name: shadowColor
desc:
Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.


**Attention**: This property works only if `show: true` configured.

name: shadowOffsetX
desc:
Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.


**Attention**: This property works only if `show: true` configured.

name: shadowOffsetY
desc:
Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.


**Attention**: This property works only if `show: true` configured.

name: scrollDataIndex
desc:
It works when [legend.type](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#legend.type) is `'scroll'`.

`dataIndex` of the left top most displayed item.

Although the scrolling of legend items can be controlled by calling `setOption` and specifying this property, we suggest that do not control legend in this way unless necessary (`setOption` might be time-consuming), but just use action [legendScroll](api.html#action.legend.legendScroll) to do that.

See [vertically scrollable legend](pie-legend&edit=1&reset=1) or [horizontally scrollable legend](radar2&edit=1&reset=1).

name: pageButtonItemGap
desc:
It works when [legend.type](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#legend.type) is `'scroll'`.

The gap between page buttons and page info text.

See [vertically scrollable legend](pie-legend&edit=1&reset=1) or [horizontally scrollable legend](radar2&edit=1&reset=1).

name: pageButtonGap
desc:
It works when [legend.type](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#legend.type) is `'scroll'`.

The gap between page buttons and legend items.

See [vertically scrollable legend](pie-legend&edit=1&reset=1) or [horizontally scrollable legend](radar2&edit=1&reset=1).

name: pageButtonPosition
desc:
It works when [legend.type](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#legend.type) is `'scroll'`.

The position of page buttons and page info. Optional values:

+ `'start'`: on the left or top.
+ `'end'`: on the right or bottom.

See [vertically scrollable legend](pie-legend&edit=1&reset=1) or [horizontally scrollable legend](radar2&edit=1&reset=1).

name: pageFormatter
desc:
It works when [legend.type](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#legend.type) is `'scroll'`.

Page info formatter. It is `'{current}/{total}'` by default, where `{current}` is current page number (start from 1), and `{total}` is the total page number.

If `pageFormatter` is a function, it should return a string. The parameters is:
```ts
{
current: number
total: number
}
```


See [vertically scrollable legend](pie-legend&edit=1&reset=1) or [horizontally scrollable legend](radar2&edit=1&reset=1).

name: pageIcons
desc:
It works when [legend.type](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#legend.type) is `'scroll'`.

The icons of page buttons.

children.name: horizontal
children.desc:
The icons of page buttons when [legend.orient](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#legend.orient) is `'horizontal'`.

It should be an array, `[previous page button, next page button]`, `['M0,0L12,-10L12,10z', 'M0,0L-12,-10L-12,10z']` by default.

For the each item of the array,



It can be set to an image with `'image://url'` , in which URL is the link to an image, or `dataURI` of an image.


An image URL example:

```
'image://http://example.website/a/b.png'
```

A `dataURI` example:

```
'image://data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhEAAQAMQAAORHHOVSKudfOulrSOp3WOyDZu6QdvCchPGolfO0o/XBs/fNwfjZ0frl3/zy7////wAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACH5BAkAABAALAAAAAAQABAAAAVVICSOZGlCQAosJ6mu7fiyZeKqNKToQGDsM8hBADgUXoGAiqhSvp5QAnQKGIgUhwFUYLCVDFCrKUE1lBavAViFIDlTImbKC5Gm2hB0SlBCBMQiB0UjIQA7'
```



Icons can be set to arbitrary vector path via `'path://'` in ECharts. As compared with a raster image, vector paths prevent jagging and blurring when scaled, and have better control over changing colors. The size of the vector icon will be adapted automatically. Refer to [SVG PathData](http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/paths.html#PathData) for more information about the format of the path. You may export vector paths from tools like Adobe

For example:

```
'path://M30.9,53.2C16.8,53.2,5.3,41.7,5.3,27.6S16.8,2,30.9,2C45,2,56.4,13.5,56.4,27.6S45,53.2,30.9,53.2z M30.9,3.5C17.6,3.5,6.8,14.4,6.8,27.6c0,13.3,10.8,24.1,24.101,24.1C44.2,51.7,55,40.9,55,27.6C54.9,14.4,44.1,3.5,30.9,3.5z M36.9,35.8c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H36c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1V35.8z M27.8,35.8 c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H27c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1L27.8,35.8L27.8,35.8z'
```







See [vertically scrollable legend](pie-legend&edit=1&reset=1) or [horizontally scrollable legend](radar2&edit=1&reset=1).

children.name: vertical
children.desc:
The icons of page buttons when [legend.orient](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#legend.orient) is `'vertical'`.

It should be an array, `[previous page button, next page button]`, `['M0,0L20,0L10,-20z', 'M0,0L20,0L10,20z']` by default.

For the each item of the array,



It can be set to an image with `'image://url'` , in which URL is the link to an image, or `dataURI` of an image.


An image URL example:

```
'image://http://example.website/a/b.png'
```

A `dataURI` example:

```
'image://data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhEAAQAMQAAORHHOVSKudfOulrSOp3WOyDZu6QdvCchPGolfO0o/XBs/fNwfjZ0frl3/zy7////wAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACH5BAkAABAALAAAAAAQABAAAAVVICSOZGlCQAosJ6mu7fiyZeKqNKToQGDsM8hBADgUXoGAiqhSvp5QAnQKGIgUhwFUYLCVDFCrKUE1lBavAViFIDlTImbKC5Gm2hB0SlBCBMQiB0UjIQA7'
```



Icons can be set to arbitrary vector path via `'path://'` in ECharts. As compared with a raster image, vector paths prevent jagging and blurring when scaled, and have better control over changing colors. The size of the vector icon will be adapted automatically. Refer to [SVG PathData](http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/paths.html#PathData) for more information about the format of the path. You may export vector paths from tools like Adobe

For example:

```
'path://M30.9,53.2C16.8,53.2,5.3,41.7,5.3,27.6S16.8,2,30.9,2C45,2,56.4,13.5,56.4,27.6S45,53.2,30.9,53.2z M30.9,3.5C17.6,3.5,6.8,14.4,6.8,27.6c0,13.3,10.8,24.1,24.101,24.1C44.2,51.7,55,40.9,55,27.6C54.9,14.4,44.1,3.5,30.9,3.5z M36.9,35.8c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H36c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1V35.8z M27.8,35.8 c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H27c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1L27.8,35.8L27.8,35.8z'
```







See [vertically scrollable legend](pie-legend&edit=1&reset=1) or [horizontally scrollable legend](radar2&edit=1&reset=1).

name: pageIconColor
desc:
It works when [legend.type](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#legend.type) is `'scroll'`.

The color of page buttons.

See [vertically scrollable legend](pie-legend&edit=1&reset=1) or [horizontally scrollable legend](radar2&edit=1&reset=1).

name: pageIconInactiveColor
desc:
It works when [legend.type](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#legend.type) is `'scroll'`.

The color of page buttons when they are inactive.

See [vertically scrollable legend](pie-legend&edit=1&reset=1) or [horizontally scrollable legend](radar2&edit=1&reset=1).

name: pageIconSize
desc:
It works when [legend.type](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#legend.type) is `'scroll'`.

The size of page buttons. It can be a number, or an array, like `[10, 3]`, represents `[width, height]`.

See [vertically scrollable legend](pie-legend&edit=1&reset=1) or [horizontally scrollable legend](radar2&edit=1&reset=1).

name: pageTextStyle
desc:
It works when [legend.type](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#legend.type) is `'scroll'`.

The text style of page info.

children.name: color
children.desc: text color.

children.name: fontStyle
children.desc:
font style.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'italic'`
+ `'oblique'`

children.name: fontWeight
children.desc:
font thick weight.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'bold'`
+ `'bolder'`
+ `'lighter'`
+ 100 | 200 | 300 | 400...

children.name: fontFamily
children.desc:
font family.

Can also be 'serif' , 'monospace', ...

children.name: fontSize
children.desc: font size.

children.name: lineHeight
width
children.desc:
Width of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. In most cases, there is no need to specify it. You may want to use it in some cases like make simple table or using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

`width` can also be percent string, like `'100%'`, which represents the percent of `contentWidth` (that is, the width without `padding`) of its container box. It is based on `contentWidth` because that each text fragment is layout based on the `content box`, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on `outerWith` in prectice.


Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.name: height
children.desc:
Height of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. You may want to use it in some cases like using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.name: textBorderColor
children.desc: Stroke color of the text.

children.name: textBorderWidth
children.desc: Stroke line width of the text.

children.name: textBorderType
children.desc:
Stroke line type of the text.


Possible values are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

Since `v5.0.0`, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray) of the line. With
`textBorderDashOffset`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

For example：
```ts
{

textBorderType: [5, 10],

textBorderDashOffset: 5
}
```

children.name: textBorderDashOffset
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the line dash offset. With
`textBorderType`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset) for more details.

children.name: textShadowColor
children.desc: Shadow color of the text itself.

children.name: textShadowBlur
children.desc: Shadow blue of the text itself.

children.name: textShadowOffsetX
children.desc: Shadow X offset of the text itself.

children.name: textShadowOffsetY
children.desc: Shadow Y offset of the text itself.

children.name: width
children.desc: Width of text block.

children.name: height
children.desc: Height of text block.

children.name: overflow
children.desc:
Determine how to display the text when it's overflow. Available when `width` is set.

+ `'truncate'` Truncate the text and trailing with `ellipsis`.
+ `'break'` Break by word
+ `'breakAll'` Break by character.

children.name: ellipsis
children.desc:
Ellipsis to be displayed when `overflow` is set to `truncate`.

+ `'truncate'` Truncate the overflow lines.

name: animation
desc: Whether to use animation when page scrolls.

name: animationDurationUpdate
desc: Duration of the page scroll animation.

children.name: selectorLabel
children.desc: > Since `v4.4.0`

children.name: show
children.desc: Whether to show label.

children.name: distance
children.desc: Distance to the host graphic element.

children.name: rotate
children.desc:
Rotate label, from -90 degree to 90, positive value represents rotate anti-clockwise.

See: [label rotation](bar-label-rotation).

children.name: offset
children.desc: Whether to move text slightly. For example: `[30, 40]` means move `30` horizontally and move `40` vertically.

children.name: color
children.desc:
text color.




If set as `'inherit'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.

children.name: fontStyle
children.desc:
font style.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'italic'`
+ `'oblique'`

children.name: fontWeight
children.desc:
font thick weight.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'bold'`
+ `'bolder'`
+ `'lighter'`
+ 100 | 200 | 300 | 400...

children.name: fontFamily
children.desc:
font family.

Can also be 'serif' , 'monospace', ...

children.name: fontSize
children.desc: font size.

children.name: align
verticalAlign
lineHeight
backgroundColor
borderColor
children.desc:
Border color of the text fragment.




If set as `'inherit'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.

children.name: borderWidth
children.desc: Border width of the text fragment.

children.name: borderType
children.desc:
the text fragment border type.



Possible values are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

Since `v5.0.0`, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray) of the line. With
`borderDashOffset`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

For example：
```ts
{

borderType: [5, 10],

borderDashOffset: 5
}
```

children.name: borderDashOffset
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the line dash offset. With
`borderType`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset) for more details.

children.name: borderRadius
children.desc: Border radius of the text fragment.

children.name: padding
children.desc:
Padding of the text fragment, for example:

+ `padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]`: represents padding of `[top, right, bottom, left]`.
+ `padding: 4`: represents `padding: [4, 4, 4, 4]`.
+ `padding: [3, 4]`: represents `padding: [3, 4, 3, 4]`.

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

children.name: shadowColor
children.desc: Shadow color of the text block.

children.name: shadowBlur
children.desc: Show blur of the text block.

children.name: shadowOffsetX
children.desc: Shadow X offset of the text block.

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Shadow Y offset of the text block.

children.name: width
children.desc:
Width of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. In most cases, there is no need to specify it. You may want to use it in some cases like make simple table or using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

`width` can also be percent string, like `'100%'`, which represents the percent of `contentWidth` (that is, the width without `padding`) of its container box. It is based on `contentWidth` because that each text fragment is layout based on the `content box`, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on `outerWith` in prectice.


Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.name: height
children.desc:
Height of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. You may want to use it in some cases like using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.desc:
Stroke color of the text.




If set as `'inherit'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.

children.name: textBorderWidth
children.desc: Stroke line width of the text.

children.name: textBorderType
children.desc:
Stroke line type of the text.


Possible values are:

+ `'dotted'`

Since `v5.0.0`, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray) of the line. With
`textBorderDashOffset`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

For example：
```ts

textBorderDashOffset: 5

```

name: selector
selectorLabel
desc:
> Since `v4.4.0`



The text label style of the selector button, which is displayed by default.

children.name: show
children.desc: Whether to show label.

children.name: distance
children.desc: Distance to the host graphic element.

children.name: rotate
children.desc:
Rotate label, from -90 degree to 90, positive value represents rotate anti-clockwise.

See: [label rotation](bar-label-rotation).

children.name: offset
children.desc: Whether to move text slightly. For example: `[30, 40]` means move `30` horizontally and move `40` vertically.

children.name: color
children.desc:
text color.




If set as `'inherit'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.

children.name: fontStyle
children.desc:
font style.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'italic'`
+ `'oblique'`

children.name: fontWeight
children.desc:
font thick weight.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'bold'`
+ `'bolder'`
+ `'lighter'`
+ 100 | 200 | 300 | 400...

children.name: fontFamily
children.desc:
font family.

Can also be 'serif' , 'monospace', ...

children.name: fontSize
children.desc: font size.

children.name: align
verticalAlign
lineHeight
backgroundColor
borderColor
children.desc:
Border color of the text fragment.




If set as `'inherit'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.

children.name: borderWidth
children.desc: Border width of the text fragment.

children.name: borderType
children.desc:
the text fragment border type.



Possible values are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

Since `v5.0.0`, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray) of the line. With
`borderDashOffset`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

For example：
```ts
{

borderType: [5, 10],

borderDashOffset: 5
}
```

children.name: borderDashOffset
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the line dash offset. With
`borderType`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset) for more details.

children.name: borderRadius
children.desc: Border radius of the text fragment.

children.name: padding
children.desc:
Padding of the text fragment, for example:

+ `padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]`: represents padding of `[top, right, bottom, left]`.
+ `padding: 4`: represents `padding: [4, 4, 4, 4]`.
+ `padding: [3, 4]`: represents `padding: [3, 4, 3, 4]`.

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

children.name: shadowColor
children.desc: Shadow color of the text block.

children.name: shadowBlur
children.desc: Show blur of the text block.

children.name: shadowOffsetX
children.desc: Shadow X offset of the text block.

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Shadow Y offset of the text block.

children.name: width
children.desc:
Width of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. In most cases, there is no need to specify it. You may want to use it in some cases like make simple table or using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

`width` can also be percent string, like `'100%'`, which represents the percent of `contentWidth` (that is, the width without `padding`) of its container box. It is based on `contentWidth` because that each text fragment is layout based on the `content box`, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on `outerWith` in prectice.


Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.name: height
children.desc:
Height of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. You may want to use it in some cases like using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.name: textBorderColor
children.desc:
Stroke color of the text.




If set as `'inherit'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.

children.name: textBorderWidth
children.desc: Stroke line width of the text.

children.name: textBorderType
children.desc:
Stroke line type of the text.


Possible values are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

Since `v5.0.0`, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray) of the line. With
`textBorderDashOffset`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

For example：
```ts
{

textBorderType: [5, 10],

textBorderDashOffset: 5
}
```

children.name: textBorderDashOffset
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the line dash offset. With
`textBorderType`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset) for more details.

children.name: textShadowColor
children.desc: Shadow color of the text itself.

children.name: textShadowBlur
children.desc: Shadow blue of the text itself.

children.name: textShadowOffsetX
children.desc: Shadow X offset of the text itself.

children.name: textShadowOffsetY
children.desc: Shadow Y offset of the text itself.

children.name: width
children.desc: Width of text block.

children.name: height
children.desc: Height of text block.

children.name: overflow
children.desc:
Determine how to display the text when it's overflow. Available when `width` is set.

+ `'truncate'` Truncate the text and trailing with `ellipsis`.
+ `'break'` Break by word
+ `'breakAll'` Break by character.

children.name: ellipsis
children.desc:
Ellipsis to be displayed when `overflow` is set to `truncate`.

+ `'truncate'` Truncate the overflow lines.

children.name: rich
color
children.desc:
text color.




If set as `'inherit'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.

children.name: fontStyle
children.desc:

+ `'normal'`
+ `'italic'`
+ `'oblique'`

children.name: fontWeight

name: selectorPosition
desc:
> Since `v4.4.0`



The position of the selector button, which can be placed at the end or start of the legend component, the corresponding values are `'end'` and `'start'`. By default, when the legend is laid out horizontally, the selector is placed at the end of it, and when the legend is laid out vertically, the selector is placed at the start of it.

name: selectorItemGap
desc:
> Since `v4.4.0`



The gap between the selector button.

name: selectorButtonGap
desc:
> Since `v4.4.0`



The gap between selector button and legend component.
